insight:
## GERMINATION PHASE ANALYSIS - 24HR REPORT

### SUMMARY
Environmental conditions remain stable and favorable for germination, with consistent temperature and humidity levels supporting early seed development.

### KEY FINDINGS
• **Optimal germination environment**: Temperature averaging 26.3°C and humidity at 63.6% fall within ideal ranges for most seed varieties
• **Soil moisture trending upward**: 20% increase from low (49.95%) to peak (70.41%) indicates improving water availability for germinating seeds
• **Light exposure anomaly**: Unusually low reading of 4.3 lux detected at hour 14, suggesting potential equipment issue or obstruction during daylight hours
• **Sensor gaps identified**: pH and TDS sensors showing zero readings throughout period, limiting nutrient monitoring capability

### RECOMMENDATIONS
• **Investigate light sensor**: Check for obstructions or calibration issues causing the dramatic light drop during what should be peak daylight hours
• **Activate nutrient monitoring**: Ensure pH and TDS sensors are properly connected and calibrated to track soil chemistry during this critical germination phase

*Note: Non-functional pH/TDS sensors limit comprehensive analysis during this crucial development stage.*

correlations.description: When temperature rises, humidity tends to drop (natural inverse correlation)
